page.title: 14MORE HAZARDS IN CANNICH
page.content: Dense forests in close proximity to the{farming}areas provide excellent cover for foxes which prey on sheep flocks. Heavy losses are incurred at lambing time and sometimes even older sheep are attacked by these{vermin during the Winter. Golden Eagles, reputed to be rare, but in fact quite plentiful, have been seen to attack and devour quite big lambs, not just young weak ones, but the{conservation laws protect them totally. There are many other{birds of prey}which present real dangers to sheep and lambs. Pine Martens destroy poultry. They too are on the increase in the forests. It is thought they are also the culprits when young lambs are bitten about the head and ears but not killed instantly. Infections develop and death usually results a few weeks later.
